metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8036 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: Heap-based buffer overflow in ARM mbed TLS (formerly PolarSSL) 1.3.x before 1.3.14 and 2.x before 2.1.2 allows remote SSL servers to cause a denial of service (client crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a long session ticket name to the session ticket extension, which is not properly handled when creating a ClientHello message to resume a session.  NOTE: this identifier was SPLIT from CVE-2015-5291 per ADT3 due to different affected version ranges.

criterions.comment: polarssl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
